title: Theory-Practice Integrated Instructional Design to Develop Cognitive Learning Potential in Physical Education

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental principles of physical education, practical experience, and familiarity with VR/simulation-based learning tools
context.additional_context: Learners, as physical education practitioners, focus on applying cognitive learning strategies in the field. Blended learning is conducted using VR simulations and mobile apps in a smartphone-centric technological environment.

learning_goals: By analyzing strategic thinking processes in physical activities, learners can be taught a cognitive learning framework.
Develop activities that stimulate learners' intrinsic motivation through lesson designs integrating theory and practice in VR simulation environments.
Apply tools to measure the impact of learners' academic self-efficacy on cognitive learning outcomes via formative assessment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
